ratings.comment: Is really rude to students who ask questions or do not understand the poorly-communicated requirements. Very condescending and clearly doesn't know what she's doing. Doesn't seem to know how to use Canvas and does not clearly outline anything. Instructions often contradict eachother.

I learned a lot of strategies in her class, but the grading system sucked. You get points taken off for any minor mistake that you do, and everything is graded on a 4-point scale, so if you get a 3/4 your grade is immensely affected. Lectures are long/boring and she often beats around the bush. Take it with another professor if you can.
She definitely could've been more upfront about grading and stuff, but all of us learned a huge amount in her class. She was thoughtful and (usually) gave good explanations.

I felt like she meant well but this did not translate whatsoever. Unclear grading criteria leading to terrible individual grades. When asked by the class for a rubric, she denied that we needed one. You basically have to guess how she wants you to answer a question. Gets defensive when asking about grading as well. Take with someone else if you can

The class isn't difficult due to the material, but rather due to the sheer amount of work you're expected to complete in such a short period of time. Unclear grading criteria + an insanely harsh grader. Also, the lectures are 2 hours long and mind-numbingly boring. Prof means well so I feel bad being harsh, but avoid 319 with her if you can.
